alert.note: Alert for Coffee; Dale; Geneva; Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 27 at 12:24PM CST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN DALE...SOUTHEASTERN COFFEE...CENTRAL GENEVA...WEST CENTRAL HOUSTON AND NORTHWESTERN HOLMES COUNTIES THROUGH 115 PM CST... At 1224 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles southwest of Enterprise to 10 miles north of De Funiak Springs to 7 miles north of Niceville. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Daleville, Geneva, Enterprise, Fort Novosel, Hartford, Level Plains, Slocomb, Clayhatchee, Black, Chancellor, Kellys Crossroads, Knox Field, Gerald, Central City, Geneva Municipal A/P, Hendrix Crossroad, Cairns Aaf, Smith Crossroads, Izagora, and New Hope. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
